quora.title: MySQL sharding at Quora
quora.abstract:
Team: Nagavamsi (Vamsi) Ponnekanti, Lingduo Kong, Hwan Seung Yeo (manager)

quora.author: Vamsi Ponnekanti

quora.title: Adopting Kubernetes at Quora
quora.abstract: Containerization is an exciting area of work at Quora that we hope will enable multiple engineering teams to move more quickly toward Quora’s mission. After having first experimented with using Kubernetes over a year ago, it has since become a key technology for us in automating the management of co
quora.author: Taylor Barrella

quora.title: Unifying dense and sparse features for neural networks
quora.abstract: A neural network model for recommendation is typically based on both dense and sparse features. quora.author: Lei Nie

quora.author: Xinyu Zhao (赵 欣宇)

quora.title: Pycache: lightning-fast in-process caching
quora.abstract: When rendering a Web page, Quora webservers need to access many different kinds of data. Some are easy to compute (what's the name for the user with ID 2667222?), and some are more difficult (how many users follow any of the topics that this question is associated with?). quora.author: Martin Michelsen

quora.author: Kornél Csernai

quora.title: Qmessage: Handling Billions of Tasks Per Day
quora.abstract:
Authors: Bandish Chheda and Yiming Li
 
Today, we're excited to discuss Qmessage, our distributed, asynchronous task queue. We use Qmessage to handle tasks where a response is not immediately needed and would require too much time to execute during a web or API request, such as delivering answers, s
quora.author: Bandish Chheda

quora.title: Automated Infrastructure Cost Optimization at Scale with AWS EC2 Reserved Instances
quora.abstract: Quora's Infrastructure team is responsible for ensuring that all of our systems remain performant, reliable, and cost-effective as Quora continues to rapidly scale. In this post, we'll focus on cost and walk through several automated cost optimizations we've made across our infrastructure that impro
quora.author: Charley Witchakorn Kamolpornwijit

quora.title: Machine Learning Workshop: Combatting Abuse Online
quora.abstract: Quora recently hosted a workshop on using machine learning to combat spam, harassment, and sock puppets in online communities. quora.author: Shuo (Steven) Chang

quora.title: Optimizing Memcached Efficiency
quora.abstract: As Quora has continued to grow, we've continued to invest in the scalability of our infrastructure. Caching is a key component of our architecture, and we use Memcached as our primary store to cache results from slower, persistent databases. While data stores like MySQL, HBase, and Redis offer a vari
quora.author: Siyuan Fu (富思源)

quora.title: The Quora Engineering Guilds
quora.abstract: At Quora, as our product continues to grow—to over 100M unique users per month, launching in a second language, and a new advertising program—so too has our engineering organization grown. It's now reached over 80 people and counting, and while we're not at the tens-of-thousands size of some of our
quora.author: Xavier Amatriain

quora.abstract:
Authors: Lili Jiang, Shuo Chang, and Nikhil Dandekar

quora.author: Nikhil Dandekar

quora.title: Updates to Our Bug Bounty Program
quora.abstract: In order to achieve our mission of sharing and growing the world's knowledge, we need to maintain a secure platform for writers and readers. quora.author: Sriram Seshadri

quora.title: Quora at RecSys 2016
quora.abstract:
At Quora, our mission is to share and grow the world’s knowledge. Recommender systems are at the heart of this mission: our systems that recommend answers to read, questions to answer, and topics to follow are at the core of Quora's user experience. 
 
This year, Quora was a sponsor of the ACM Confe
quora.author: Nikhil Dandekar

quora.title: Asynchronous Programming in Python
quora.abstract: Quora's mission is to share and grow the world's knowledge, and to achieve that mission, we're continuing to roll out improvements that make Quora faster for our readers and writers. quora.author: Manan Nayak

quora.title: Faster Paint Times
quora.abstract: Quora's mission is to share and grow the world's knowledge, so it's critical we create a product that enables anyone to quickly read and contribute content across all platforms. To that end, the speed of our web and mobile products is one of our engineering team's top priorities. Studies have repeat
quora.author: Michael Yong

quora.title: Ensuring Quora's Resilience to Disaster
quora.abstract: Quora's mission is to share and grow the world's knowledge, and we're committed to making sure Quora is a knowledge repository that will be around forever. quora.author: Martin Michelsen

quora.title: Applications of NLP at Quora
quora.abstract: Hundreds of millions of people use Quora to discover high-quality answers to questions important to them. quora.author: Nikhil Garg

quora.abstract: Most people engage in some form or other of “information seeking” every day of their lives. On the internet, the most common way people go about information seeking is by using search engines. quora.author: Nikhil Dandekar

quora.title: Avoiding Complexity of Machine Learning Systems
quora.abstract: Today, more and more products and engineering teams rely on machine learning (referred to as ML through out this blog post). quora.author: Lei Yang

quora.title: A Machine Learning Approach to Ranking Answers on Quora
quora.abstract: Millions of people use Quora every day to find answers to their questions and make smarter decisions, find their dream jobs, raise their families better, and much more. quora.author: Kornél Csernai

quora.title: Engineers of Quora: Pranav Gokhale
quora.abstract: This is the first of a series of posts highlighting what it's like to be an engineer at Quora. quora.author: Pranav Gokhale

quora.title: Securing Quora with HTTPS
quora.abstract: We’re happy to announce that we have completed the transition to support HTTPS everywhere on Quora and have joined a growing list of websites that are fully HTTPS. HTTPS is a protocol that encrypts all communication between the web browsers and the web servers. The encryption helps prevent eavesdrop
quora.author: Abhishek Ray

quora.title: The Product Engineering Behind Most Viewed Writers
quora.abstract: Earlier this year, we rolled out the Most Viewed Writers feature to recognize writers who are most actively contributing to the topics they know and care about. quora.author: Chun-Ho Hung

quora.title: Ask To Answer as a Machine Learning Problem
quora.abstract: Ask To Answer (A2A) is a feature of Quora that allows users to send requests to other users asking them to write an answer to a particular question.  A2A is an important product feature, allowing users to route questions to the experts best qualified to answer them.  In addition to generating great
quora.author: Ofir Nachum

quora.title: Moving Fast With High Code Quality
quora.abstract: A high-quality codebase boosts the long-term development speed by making iteration, collaboration, and maintenance easier.  At Quora, we take the quality of our codebase seriously.   ​ But despite the benefits, maintaining high code quality creates a non-trivial overhead and consumes real development
quora.author: Nikhil Garg

quora.abstract: Adapted from my answer to What UX elements can Quora's team change in the iPhone app without making an App Store release? quora.author: Tommy MacWilliam

quora.title: Machine Learning at Quora

quora.author: Xavier Amatriain

quora.title: Quora Haqathon
quora.abstract:
We are excited to announce that we are going to host Quora Haqathon, an 8-hour long programming competition, where you can try your skills at solving real-world challenges.
The contest will take place from December 6, 11:00 AM PST to December 6, 7:00 PM PST. You can sign up here: Quora Haqathon   This
quora.author: Denis Yarats

quora.title: Persistent Finite State Machines in Python
quora.abstract: We all know that finite state machines are very versatile and powerful but despite the great power they wield, they are not used often enough in “real programming”.
